title: Backlog in 6th sem help!
content: I failed a subject in 6th sem. Im worried about the upcoming placement season. Will I even be allowed to sit for placements with a backlog?

comments.body: If u can clear it in the summer term clear it off, don't wait, u'll be ok.
Thanks bro, will try my best

Some companies don't allow people with active backlogs , some companies don't with previous backlogs. And some are not all don't worry

Make sure you are skilled enough for them tho
Does the transcript mention backlog?
Not sure about that

Remember that even if you lie about not having backlogs, PES knows you have one. It's not a question about whether you'll get caught, it's a question of *when*. Best case scenario, you aren't allowed to sit for the placement test and PES goes easy on you. Worst case scenario, you end up getting selected and then later get caught when you need to submit your documents to the company.
Not planning on lying to any company, I was thinking about when I have to apply for higher studies and such.
I could be wrong, but I don't think it shows up once you clear. But until you clear, it will show that you have failed a course.
Alright, thank you!

I have backlog in 2subjects what should I do now?I literally have no idea.When is backlog?Do I have to talk to them and pay them?Please help if you know

There's a fee that needs to be paid in order to rewrite the subject. Once that's paid, you can take up the exam in the next ESA session. Apparently there is one in July but I am yet to confirm the details. When writing a backlog exam it's important to note that, the entire pass or fail is based on the paper itself, which means the internal marks you gained no longer count. Once you clear a backlog paper they will update your marks card and your gpa as well. How the updates are done is a bit unclear at this time to me. For every backlog you can attempt it 4 times to pass it.

Clear the backlog within 4 years, in fact before 7th semester if you plan to get a transcript during or right after the 7th semester. If you clear within 4 years, they won't show it in your final transcript dw.
